content: fuck ice beanie by wildwood designs me caitlin reum ig @wildwooddesignsme fb facebook com/wildwooddesignsme etsy etsy com/shop/wildwooddesignsme ravelry ravelry com/patterns/sources/wildwood-designs-mes-ravelry-store materials needles us 13 9 mm circular knitting needles optional 9mm dpns for decreases or you can use the magic loop method yarn lionbrand thick & quick or any bulky weight #6 yarn yardage mc black = 38 yds/60 gr cc white = 18 yards/25 gr misc supplies scissors darning needle stitch marker sizes teen/adult size gauge with 9mm needles 4x4 square = 9 st 13 row difficulty advanced beginner key us terms k knit p purl k2tog knit two stitches together helpful links carrying long floats when you need to carry a float over more than 5 stitches https //www youtube com/watch v=dtdgr2nm9-q note if you choose to sell items created from this pattern please credit me wildwood designs me ig @wildwooddesignsme for the pattern the pattern and photographs are my property please do not alter rewrite share or sell this pattern this is for personal use only with the exception of selling items made from it thank you when your hat is completed please take a picture use hashtag #creeperbeaniewdme and tag me on instagram @wildwooddesignsme i d love to see your creations and i may even share your picture if you have any questions please email me at wildwooddesignsme@gmail com thank you so much for downloading this pattern i hope you have alot of fun creating your beanie teen/adult sized hat using 9mm us size 13 needle cast on 42 stitches place stitch maker and join in the round rounds 1-6 *k1 p1* to end 42 round 7 k all stitches across 42 rounds 8-22 follow chart repeats twice across for 42 total stitches around begin decrease magic loop method or dpns round 23 *k3 k2tog* until 2 stitches remain k2tog last 2 stitches 33 round 24 k all stitches across round 25 *k2 k2tog* until 5 stitches remain k2 then k3tog 24 round 26 k all stitches across round 27 *k1 k2tog* 16 round 28 k all stitches across round 29 *k2tog* around 8 use long tail and darning needle to cinch up remaining stitches and weave in ends now go rock your brand new hat at one of your local protests
